title: How to Make a Girl Like You Again

steps.title: Reflect on why her interest may have waned.
steps.content: Reflect on why her interest may have waned. Think about whether you made her feel wanted and appreciated. Did you not pay enough attention to her – or were you perhaps too clingy? Replay in your head what happened before she seemed to lose interest. [1] X Research source For example, did you say something – maybe in a teasing way – that could have insulted her or hurt her feelings? Try asking, “Did I say or do something to upset you?”

steps.title: Apologize if you think she feels wronged.
steps.content: Apologize if you think she feels wronged. Embrace your humility and put pride aside. Tell her you're sorry as soon as possible, through a note or in person. Address the issue with a kind apology, even if you don't feel completely at fault. [2] X Research source Try saying, “I sincerely apologize. Can you forgive me?” Reader Poll: We asked 546 wikiHow readers about the best way to apologize to a girl who’s really mad at you, and only 5% of them recommended taking her out to her favorite restaurant or activity . [Take Poll] Offering a genuine apology might be a better tactic.

steps.title: Give her a gift that shows you care.
steps.content: Give her a gift that shows you care. You could bring her a bouquet of flowers. [3] X Research source Or, you could put more thought into the gesture and give her something related to her interests, that you know she'll like. The gift doesn't necessarily have to cost anything. For example, give her a sticker of a band or organization she likes. Is there a travel destination she loves? Try giving her a souvenir of that place, to show her you care about her interests. You can send her something digitally for free, such as an e-card.

steps.title: Spend time apart, but don't ignore her.
steps.content: Spend time apart, but don't ignore her. Let her know that you notice her through small gestures. Smile or wave at her when you see her. Send her a single text, if you haven't talked recently. This lets her know you care and are not completely uninterested in her. Try texting, “Hi! Haven't talked to you in a while. How are you?”

steps.title: Socialize with others.
steps.content: Socialize with others. Meet new people and expand your group of friends. Go out with people who are positive and make life fun. Staying busy can help you feel upbeat instead of dwelling on your relationship status. [4] X Research source For example, try joining a new activity, such as a hobby class or sport.

steps.title: Be patient.
steps.content: Be patient. Don't expect to be able to earn her interest back immediately. You may want to wait about 30 days before attempting to reconnect with her. After a month of little or no contact, she will be more likely to miss you. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Ask her what qualities she initially found attractive in you.
steps.content: Ask her what qualities she initially found attractive in you. They may be physical, intellectual, emotional or spiritual. Discussing the positive feelings she had towards you in the first place will encourage her to embrace those feelings again. [6] X Research source Try saying, “I'm just curious…what was it about me that you were interested in when we first met?”

steps.title: Pay attention to her.
steps.content: Pay attention to her. Tell her that you're there to listen any time she wants to talk. If she is willing to talk, give her your full interest and attention. [7] X Expert Source Eddy Baller Dating Coach Expert Interview. 7 February 2020. Don't rush her or try to offer easy solutions; she'll feel more heard if you just listen and reinforce that you support her choices. [8] X Research source Try saying, “I understand your feelings,” or “I support you.”

steps.title: Convey that you're improving yourself.
steps.content: Convey that you're improving yourself. Without bragging, subtly work into your conversation ways that you're working on yourself. Tell her something new you've learned, and how it's expanded the way you look at things. [9] X Research source People tend to be attracted to others who are intellectually engaging and interesting. [10] X Research source For example, if you've done well at work or in school, casually mention it. Try saying, “That reminds me of something I read about the other day…”
